rules.natural: The Project completes ahead of schedule, or if the Conservator identifies a problem with the Pigment, then the Pigment does not require special treatment.
The Project receives an extension, or the Project does not meet its deadline.
If the Project passes inspection, then the regulatory body approves the Project.
If the Project achieves its milestone, then the Project passes inspection.
The Project wins an award, or if the Project meets its deadline, then the Project gains recognition.
If the regulatory body approves the Project, then the Consortium does not have funding for the Project.
If the Conservator uses traditional tools, then the Conservator follows conservation guidelines.
The Conservator uses traditional tools, or the Conservator uses digital tools.
If the Conservator applies chemical treatments, then the Conservator does not cause damage to the Artwork.
If the Conservator uses mechanical methods, then the Conservator does not cause damage to the Artwork.
If the Conservator identifies a problem with the Pigment, then the Pigment requires special treatment.
The Conservator identifies a problem with the Pigment, or the Conservator applies chemical treatments, or the Conservator uses mechanical methods.
If it is not the case that using digital tools leads the Conservator to follow guidelines, then the Conservator causes damage to the Artwork.
If it is not the case that not following guidelines results in regulatory body approval of the Project, then the Consortium halts the project.
If it is not the case that not following guidelines leads to regulatory body approval of the Project, then the Consortium does not halt the project.
If the Conservator does not follow guidelines, then the Consortium has funding for the Project.
If the Conservator does not follow guidelines, then the Project meets its deadline.
If the Conservator does not follow guidelines, then the Project achieves its milestone.
